text:
Tres años después del #HuracánMaria, nuestros compatriotas siguen demostrando su resiliencia mientras siguen luchando para recuperarse de este desastre natural.
 
Hoy, honramos a las víctimas y aplaudimos la determinación de estos estadounidenses frente a la adversidad. 🇵🇷🇺🇸

Three years after #HurricaneMaria, our fellow citizens in #PuertoRico continue proving their resilience as they fight to recover from this destructive natural disaster.

Today, we honor the victims and applaud the determination of these Americans in the face of adversity. 🇵🇷 🇺🇸

For my thoughts are not your thoughts, nor are your ways my ways. For as the heavens are higher than the earth,so are my ways higher than your ways,my thoughts higher than your thoughts.

Isaiah 55:8-9

Now is not the time to throw up our hands in despair. Progress can be slow, it can be painful. But now more than ever, it’s time to roll up our sleeves, stand up for the country we love, and get to work.

“My most fervent wish is that I will not be replaced until a new president is installed.” – Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, in her final moments before passing.

We must honor that wish and fight for her legacy.

We still must do everything we can to help the people of Puerto Rico recover from the hurricanes and earthquakes, the economic crisis, and the COVID-19 pandemic. That starts with leadership in our federal government that respects all of its citizens. I will stay in that fight.

Three years ago today, Hurricane Maria devastated Puerto Rico and the US Virgin Islands. I saw firsthand how Trump’s slow and ineffective response led to thousands of deaths and untold misery. The cruelty wasn’t an accident – it was part of their plan.

Last night I stood at the steps of the Supreme Court and told the thousands of people gathered there: in Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s memory, I will fight. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1307718404598530048/img/5qJmLa26ZhKRgNNQ.jpg

Donald Trump’s response to this time of crisis has been both incompetent and morally bankrupt.

Our president has a duty to protect the nation—and he has failed on all fronts.

https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/u-s-covid-19-death-toll-surpasses-200-000-n1240034

We were at the Supreme Court last night to grieve, but not to despair.

There is too much at stake going forward: Health care for millions of Americans. Dreamers. The right to join a union. Our very democracy is on the line. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1307768438639788032/img/BHCXYVq5QbEalVSR.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1307768438639788032/vid/320x568/lIBwja4h9j1ol5HI.mp4?tag=13
We can’t give in to fear and we can’t back down. Hope is not given to us—it’s created by us.
